Name: Analytics Snippet
Author: Daniel Berthereau
Description: Add a snippet, generally a javascript tracker, at the end of the public or admin pages, and allows to track json and xml requests.

Name: Analytics Snippet - Piwik
Author: Daniel Berthereau
Description: Submodule for Analytics Snippet to track json (in particular Omeka S API) and xml (like with OAI-PMH Repository) calls with Piwik.

Name: Archive Folder
Author: Daniel Berthereau
Description: Automatically import a local or remote folder into Omeka as collections, items, files, and metadata.

Name: Archive Repertory
Author: Daniel Berthereau, Omeka S port by BibLibre
Description: Keeps original names of imported files and put them in a hierarchical structure (collection / item / files) in order to get readable urls for files and to avoid an overloading of the file server.

Name: Ark
Author: BibLibre
Description: Create short, unique, meaningless, universal and persistent identifiers (ark and/or noid) and use them as urls for records.

Name: Basket
Description: Allow user to add basket

Name: Clean Url
Author: Daniel Berthereau, Omeka S port by BibLibre
Description: Displays clean, seo and readable URLs like https://example.org/first_collection/dc:identifier.

Name: COinS
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media (Omeka S port by BibLibre)
Description: Adds COinS metadata to item pages, making them Zotero readable.

Name: Collecting
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History & New Media
Description: Add collecting forms to your sites.

Name: Comment
Author: Daniel Berthereau (port and improvement from the RRCHNM Omeka Classic plugin)
Description: Add public and/or private commenting on item sets, items and media and manage them.

Name: CSS Editor
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media
Description: Add public CSS styles through the admin interface.

Name: CSV Import
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History & New Media
Description: Import content from a CSV file.

Name: Custom Advanced Search
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History & New Media
Description: Customize the advanced search form

Name: Custom Ontology
Author: Daniel Berthereau
Description: Create specific classes and properties to describe resources when no standard ontologies can be used.

Name: Custom Vocab
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History & New Media
Description: Describe your resources using vocabularies you create.

Name: Dspace Connector
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History & New Media
Description: Connect Omeka S to DSpace repositories.

Name: Easy Install
Author: Daniel Berthereau
Description: Module for installing modules and themes from the web (https://github.com and https://gitlab.com).

Name: Fedora Connector
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History & New Media
Description: Connect Omeka S to Fedora 4 repositories.

Name: File Sideload
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History & New Media
Description: Add files that are already on your server to items.

Name: Folksonomy
Author: Daniel Berthereau
Description: Add tags and tagging form to any resource to create uncontrolled vocabularies and tag clouds.

Name: Google Analytics
Author: Digirati
Description: Omeka-S module for adding Google Analytics tracking code

Name: Group
Author: Daniel Berthereau
Description: Add groups to users and resources to manage the access rights and the resource visibility in a more flexible way.

Name: Guest User
Author: Biblibre
Description: Adds a guest user role. Canâ€™t access backend, but allows plugins to use an authenticated user.

Name: IdRef
Author: BibLibre
Description: Add IdRef data type

Name: IIIFHosting
Author: Klokantech
Description: IIIFHosting connector

Name: IIIF Server
Author: Daniel Berthereau, Omeka S port by BibLibre
Description: Integrates the IIIF specifications and a simple IIP Image Server to allow to process and share instantly images of any size and medias (pdf, audio, video, 3D...) in the desired formats.

Name: Item Sets Tree
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media
Description: Gives administrators the ability to create a hierarchical tree of their collections.

Name: jQueryUI
Author: BibLibre
Description: Provides jQueryUI for other modules

Name: Ldap
Author: Tim Hollies
Description: Authenticate Omeka-S users with LDAP

Name: Lockout
Author: Daniel Berthereau (port of Johan Eenfeldt's plugin for WordPress)
Description: Limit rate of login attempts for each IP to avoid brute-force attacks.

Name: Log
Author: Daniel Berthereau
Description: Monitor all logging messages and background jobs directly in the admin board and make them translatable and easily checkable.
Tags: monitor, log, psr-3, logging, job, admin

Name: Maintenance
Author: Daniel Berthereau
Description: Add a setting to set the site under maintenance for the public. Can be disabled when unused.

Name: Mapping
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History & New Media
Description: Add location info to your items and sites.

Name: Metadata Browse
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History & New Media
Description: Adds a link to same results for metadata values.

Name: Neatline
Author: Scholars' Lab
Description: Plot your course in space and time.

Name: OAI-PMH Harvester
Author: David Dean - based on code from Roy Rosenzweig Center for History & New Media and Daniel Berthereau
Description: Harvest content from an OAI-PMH repository.

Name: OAI-PMH Repository
Author: BibLibre
Description: Exposes Omeka items as an OAI-PMH repository.

Name: OAI Pmh Harvester
Author: Vincent Buard for PSL
Description: Harvest OaiPmh repositories.

Name: Omeka 2 Importer
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History & New Media
Description: Import content from an Omeka 2 site via its API.

Name: Omeka Starter Kit
Author: Stephen Fraser
Description: Developer friendly example of Omeka module

Name: Omeka Twig
Author: Tim Hollies
Description: Use twig templates in Omeka-S themes

Name: PDF Embed
Author: John Flatness
Description: Embed PDF files within Omeka S pages

Name: PdfText
Author: Vincent BUARD
Description: Extract data from PDF files for indexation

Name: Psl
Author: BibLibre
Description: Various things specific to PSL

Name: PslSearchForm
Author: BibLibre
Description: PSL search form

Name: Reference
Author: Daniel Berthereau
Description: Adds glossary pages with the alphabetical indexes of specified classes and properties.

Name: Scripto
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History & New Media
Description: Transcribe items.

Name: Search
Author: BibLibre
Description: Add search capabilities to Omeka S

Name: Sharing
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History & New Media
Description: Share and embed content on the web

Name: Solr
Author: BibLibre
Description: Add Solr search adapter

Name: STest
Author: Patrick Murray-John
Description: Test a bunch of random stuff

Name: Timeline
Author: Daniel Berthereau
Description: Integrate the Simile Timeline and the Knightlab Timeline to create advanced timelines from the dates of items.

Name: unAPI
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History & New Media
Description: Make your item metadata discoverable using unAPI.

Name: Universal Viewer
Author: Daniel Berthereau, Omeka S port by BibLibre
Description: Integrates the Universal Viewer in order to create carousels of virtual books from image files and to display any media file (pdf, audio, video, 3D...) in a unified player.

Name: Upgrade from Omeka Classic
Author: Daniel Berthereau
Description: Add a compatibility layer to use Omeka Classic themes that were upgraded via the plugin Upgrade to Omeka Semantic.

Name: Value Suggest
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History & New Media
Description: Describe your resources using auto-suggested values from controlled vocabulary services.

Name: Zotero Import
Author: Roy Rosenzweig Center for History & New Media
Description: Import items and files from Zotero user and group libraries.
